items.text: ah, now there is a bit of shape as Boult aims very, very full. Good pace too, at 140km/h. But Mahmudullah has the gumption to keep it out
slower ball, down to 122km/h, and they pinch a single off the pad as it rolls into the leg side

items.preText: James: "SA reach 227 in their 50 overs, IND are 2 down going at just under 4 an over in response. BAN keeping the run rate just over 4.5 and wickets in hand for the last few overs... it's like we've gone back in time to the 1980s!!" -- Yes, things are refreshingly old school!
items.text: swing for Boult, but it starts too straight and hoops down the leg side

clever, clever batting! It was another slower cutter from Boult, down to 122km/h, but Mithun waited and waited and then angled his bat at the last moment to send it bouncing down to third man for four. Very fine
items.shortText: Boult to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.preText: Anns Mahboob: "Vividly remember Mahmudullah's hundred in the last world cup against England. He has grown exponentially as a player since than and I wouldn't be surprised if Bangladesh end up getting 290+, once Mahmudullah gets going. It is imperative New Zealand get him out early."
items.text: short, and it's pulled out into the deep, but there's protection at the boundary's edge

short, pulled and skied! Henry dug it in and Mithun threw himself into a pull shot, having walked at the bowler. But he couldn't control it at all, and de Grandhomme easily snaffled the chance down at fine leg

dismissal.text: Mohammad Mithun c de Grandhomme b Henry 26 (59m 33b 3x4 0x6) SR: 78.78

items.preText:
Joynul: "@Liam, yes, you missed. That 3D glass comment originate in Ind vs SA match. Lucky for you, i have been following both match in my phone on 2 different pages simultaneously " -- Thanks for the clarification. Confusing! Then again, I have been commentating on both matches today.

Meanwhile, here's Mosaddek, who put on 66 in quick time against South Africa alongside Mahmudullah in Bangladesh's previous match
items.text: tapped down behind square on the off side. Mosaddek wants to call him through, but Mahmudullah's not interested

items.preText: Rajiv Guliani: "@James, Congratulations, your comment was posted in both matches." -- There should be some sort of prize for this
items.text: a touch of seam movement in to him, and he works with it to nurdle a single down to fine leg
on a length, defended solidly to cover
items.shortText: Henry to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.preText: According to the Forecaster, Bangladesh will finish on 271 (at the fall of the 5th wicket); the Mithun wicket has brought down the expected score by only 4 runs, from 275 to 271
items.text: beaten on the outside edge, Mosaddek poking flat-footed from the crease at one that held its line
items.shortText: Henry to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: pushed down the leg side, and that's one more for the extras column

items.preText: Suyog: "New Zealand teaching Bangladesh how to play at the big stage. They have almost made sure that the target would be somewhere around 280, if not more. They will achieve it with 5-6 overs to spare at least." -- There's no way this comment could come back to haunt you. Nope. None at all
items.text: Mosaddek whips his bat over a straight one, collecting a single just behind square on the leg side
Mosaddek hops into a good-looking cut, but he picks out point to perfection
items.shortText: Boult to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.preText: Jeyaram: "I see James's comments about 1980's are published in both the matches.. He is extremely lucky. My comment got posted only once in more than 10 years... Writing letters to god.." -- Is that a Boxcar Racer reference?
items.text: sharp single! Mosaddek dead-bats it into the off side and they set off, even as Guptill swoops. But the shy goes wide
past the outside edge! Boult bent his back on this one and found some lift off a length as it hit the seam, going over the top of Mahmudullah's wafting cut

items.preText: AA Musabbir: "@naser: why be surprised to see sabbir benched only?liton is benched after two consecutive fifties. One against Ireland and one against India in warm up. Rubel is benched who is the best speedy bowler of Bangladesh. unusual for old Bangladesh who are familiar to contain a player for next 10-15 matches just for scoring 1 fifty or a good spell in a match. Days are changed now. Now even Bangladeshi supporters dare to comment widely as this team as a champion!!"
items.text: a firm drive sends the ball bouncing out to deep cover
chopped down behind point, using the angle offered by Boult's line

items.preText: Duncan Ward: "I've had 6 comments posted during this world cup so far, and indeed 11 since the start of the English summer, but James has undone me by getting his commented posted in simultaneous matches!! I'm in awe. "
items.text: another cutter from Boult, another sharp single from the batters. Just hit it to cover and set off. Again it's Guptill with the swoop and shy, but again it goes wide!

items.preText: Kartik: "Liam, how on earth are you here? Thought you were commentating on SA-Ind game? Or are you multitasking" -- With four screens, two laptops, a cellphone and an iPad, I can do anything
items.text: Ferguson starts full, Mahmudullah meeting the ball on the full and driving to cover
yorker, just outside off, and it's squeezed out to point, where Guptill - who has been very busy - dives to cut it off
Mahmudullah jumps into a cut, aiming the shot past Guptill this time
full and straight at 139km/h, the drive rolling straight to mid on
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: is this a drop? Mosaddek through his hands into a cut, and the ball flew to Guptill at point ... actually, it's bounced just in front of him. A stinger, and he wrings his hand in pain

items.preText: James: "Sorry Jeyaram (and cricinfo readers, commentators et al), I never thought I'd be that lucky. But I see your luck has changed! Will SA's fortunes improve I wonder...." -- If James can do it ... Faf can too?
items.text: a firm push to cover, and a dot ball, ends the over

items.preText: Time for the final Powerplay. And Santner comes back.
items.text: Mahmudullah lunges forward and pushes a single through cover
